__init__(choices, message=None, title=None, *, name=None, id=None, classes=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

A dialog where the user can select one of several choices.

Parameters:

  • choices (list[str]) ‚Äì The choices to provide.

  • message (str, optional) ‚Äì A message to show above the choices.

  • title (str, optional) ‚Äì A title to render above the dialog.

  • name (_type_, optional) ‚Äì A name to pass to the underlying screen instance.

  • id (_type_, optional) ‚Äì A unique ID to identify this dialog by.

  • classes (_type_, optional) ‚Äì Additional CSS classes this dialog should have.

compose()[source]ÔÉÅ

Called by Textual to create child widgets.

This method is called when a widget is mounted or by setting recompose=True when calling [refresh()][textual.widget.Widget.refresh].

Note that you don‚Äôt typically need to explicitly call this method.

Example

```python def compose(self) -> ComposeResult:

yield Header() yield Label(‚ÄúPress the button below:‚Äù) yield Button() yield Footer()

```

Bases: App

TITLE: str | None = 'BetterLaunch'ÔÉÅ

A class variable to set the default title for the application.

To update the title while the app is running, you can set the [title][textual.app.App.title] attribute. See also [the Screen.TITLE attribute][textual.screen.Screen.TITLE].

BINDINGS: ClassVar[list[BindingType]] = [Binding(key='ctrl+q', action='quit', description='Quit', show=True, key_display=None, priority=False, tooltip='', id=None, system=False), Binding(key='space', action='toggle_mute', description='Mute', show=True, key_display=None, priority=False, tooltip='', id=None, system=False), Binding(key='f1', action='toggle_sidebar', description='Sidebar', show=True, key_display=None, priority=False, tooltip='', id=None, system=False), Binding(key='f2', action='toggle_log_names', description='Names', show=True, key_display=None, priority=False, tooltip='', id=None, system=False), Binding(key='f3', action='toggle_log_icons', description='Icons', show=True, key_display=None, priority=False, tooltip='', id=None, system=False)]ÔÉÅ

Default TCSS.

classmethod setup_logging()[source]ÔÉÅ

Sets up a few things to make sure log messages can be parsed by the TUI.

__init__(launch_func, disable_colors=False, max_log_length=1000)[source]ÔÉÅ

Creates a new TUI instance. Only one of these should be created and started.

Since UIs (including TUIs) should usually run on the main thread, the passed in launch function will actually be run on a separate thread.

Parameters:

  • launch_func (Callable) ‚Äì The launch function of the launch file. Note that no arguments will be provided to this function - use partial or a wrapper with bound arguments for anything you need to pass to the function.

  • disable_colors (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, the TUI will not render any colors (and hopefully nothing else will either). This will set the NO_COLOR environment variable.

  • max_log_length (bool, optional) ‚Äì How many log messages to keep in the buffer for scrolling.

compose()[source]ÔÉÅ

Yield child widgets for a container.

This method should be implemented in a subclass.

Return type:

Iterable[Widget]

on_mount()[source]ÔÉÅ
exit(reason='UI terminated')[source]ÔÉÅ

Exit the app, and return the supplied result.

Parameters:

  • result ‚Äì Return value.

  • return_code ‚Äì The return code. Use non-zero values for error codes.

  • message ‚Äì Optional message to display on exit.

copy_log_entry(entry)[source]ÔÉÅ

Tries to copy a log entry to the clipboard.

Copying some text to the clipboard is surprisingly complex, involving different OS-dependent backends. This function uses pyperclip to handle the brunt work.

Parameters:

entry (LogEntry) ‚Äì The log entry to copy to clipboard.
